item.title: Crawling with Scrapy - Scraping TED Talk Transcripts
item.description: I've been looking for a project that will allow me to kick the tires on Spacy, the text analysis framework for python. If you're confused ... I did mean Spacy, it's not my dyslexia flaring up. Before I embark on a text analysis project, I first need an interesting text dataset... hence, this post about Scrapy and the process of scraping TED Talk transcripts.

item.title: Managing Parallel Operations with Pandas Groupby
item.description: Python's Pool method from the multiprocessing library is an extremely useful tool for speeding up Python jobs.

item.title: Hellinger Distance for Topic Model Visualization
item.description:
Topic Similarity Network

An interesting way to visualize topics generated by Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) is to plot a graph with nodes representing topics and edges representing distance between topics.

item.title: Iman Conover Method for Generating Correlated Samples
item.description: An important aspect of Monte Carlo simulation is capturing interdependencies between variables. A popular approach is to approximate linear correlation between variables via Rank Correlation using the Iman-Conover Method.

item.title: Basic Heroku with Python (Anaconda) & Flask
item.description: This is my first Heroku app with Python and will serve to document the process for later apps.

item.title: Logistic Regression Machine Learning Review
item.description: Here I reproduce the logistic regression material covered in Andrew Ng's Machine learning course on Coursera. Logistic regression is a canonical approach and I hope to gain familiarity with the ML flavor notation by deriving its form.
